Calculate the Manhattan distance for the object below.
$$
A =
\begin{bmatrix}
-3 & 2 & 4 \\
5 & -1 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$$
```{r}
A <- matrix(c(-3, 5, 2, -1, 4, 0), nrow = 2, byrow = F)
dist(A,method="manhattan")
```
Calculate the Euclidean distance for the Matrix below.
$$
B =
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & -4 & 5 & 3 & -1 & 0 \\
-2 & 1 & -3 & 4 & -5 & 2 \\
3 & -2 & 1 & -4 & 0 & -1 \\
4 & 0 & -5 & 2 & 3 & -2
\end{bmatrix}
$$
```{r}
B <- matrix(c(
  2, -4, 5, 3, -1, 0,
  -2, 1, -3, 4, -5, 2,
  3, -2, 1, -4, 0, -1,
  4, 0, -5, 2, 3, -2
), nrow = 4, byrow = TRUE)

dist(B,method="euclidian",diag=T)
```
Calculate the Minkowski distance with a p value of 3.
$$
C =
\begin{bmatrix}
4 & -3 & 2 & -1 \\
-5 & 3 & 1 & 0 \\
2 & -2 & 4 & -4
\end{bmatrix}
$$
```{r}
C <- matrix(c(
  4, -3, 2, -1,
  -5, 3, 1, 0,
  2, -2, 4, -4
), nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE)
dist(C,method="minkowski",p=3,diag=T)
```

Complete a hierarchical clustering process on the matrix below using single linkage clustering.
$$
D =
\begin{bmatrix}
0 & 2.1 & 3.5 & 4.2 & 5.1 \\
2.1 & 0 & 1.8 & 3.3 & 4.7 \\
3.5 & 1.8 & 0 & 2.5 & 4.0 \\
4.2 & 3.3 & 2.5 & 0 & 3.6 \\
5.1 & 4.7 & 4.0 & 3.6 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
$$
```{r}
D <- matrix(c(
  0, 2.1, 3.5, 4.2, 5.1,
  2.1, 0, 1.8, 3.3, 4.7,
  3.5, 1.8, 0, 2.5, 4.0,
  4.2, 3.3, 2.5, 0, 3.6,
  5.1, 4.7, 4.0, 3.6, 0
), nrow = 5, byrow = TRUE)
hc <- hclust(as.dist(D),method="single")
plot(hc)
```
